Docs.summary: Represents a configuration section in the element of the configuration file. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingJsonSerializationSection> class enables you to programmatically access and modify the `jsonSerialization` element of the configuration section for using AJAX functionality in ASP.NET.
Use this type to set serialization and deserialization configuration values for AJAX-enabled applications.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify values for properties of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingJsonSerializationSection> class.
``` <system.web.extensions> <scripting> <webServices> <jsonSerialization maxJsonLength="1000" /> </webServices> </scripting> </system.web.extensions> ```
The following example demonstrates how to access <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingJsonSerializationSection> programmatically.

Gets or sets the maximum length that is accepted by the object for JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) strings.
Docs.value: An integer that represents the maximum length for JSON strings. The default is 102400 characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingJsonSerializationSection.MaxJsonLength%2A> property applies only to the internal <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> instance that is used by the asynchronous communication layer to invoke Web services methods.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the limit for constraining the number of object levels to process.
Docs.value: The number of object levels. The default is 100.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingJsonSerializationSection.RecursionLimit%2A> property refers to the maximum level of an object hierarchy that <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> will process when deserializing a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) string or when serializing an object.
The value of <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingJsonSerializationSection.RecursionLimit%2A> applies only to the internal <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> instance that is used by the asynchronous communication layer to invoke Web services methods.

Docs.exception: The property is being set to a value that is less than one.
